title: Executive Summary
text:
This report provides strategic corporate research regarding a number of organizations that have mismanaged funds, to the detriment of Medi-Cal recipients and other low-income Californians, by neglecting medical treatment facilities at Fresno CRMC and instead enhancing the neighboring and affluent Clovis CMC. This report begins by investigating Community Hospitals of Central California and will expand to also include:

Fresno Community Hospital and Medical Center
Community Health System
Board of Trustees for Community Hospitals of Central California and Fresno Community Hospital and Medical Center

The framework for this report is taken from the strategic corporate research guide website. And its chapters correspond to the 24 question model described in Juravich’s “Beating Global Capital” [1].




References

1. Juravich T (2AD) Beating global capital: A framework and method for union strategic corporate research and campaigns

title: 1. Introduction
text:
When Googling CHCC, the website that comes up first is “Community Medical Centers”. They list 4 hospital facilities on their site, but no location for a headquarters. These locations are:

Clovis Community Medical Center

2755 Herndon Avenue
Clovis, CA 93611
(559) 324-4000

Community Regional Medical Center

2823 Fresno Street
Fresno, CA 93721
(559) 459-6000

Fresno Heart & Surgical Hospital

15 E. Audubon Drive
Fresno, CA 93720
(559) 433-8000

Community Behavioral Health Center

7171 N. Cedar Avenue
Fresno, CA 93720
(559) 449-8000




Below is basic information pulled from (“Giving Tuesday Data Commons 990 Datasets API” 2025). For all variable definitions see Section 4.1.

title: 1. Introduction
text:
EIN: 942437106
When Googling CHCC [1], the website that comes up first is “Community Medical Centers” [1] and not “Community Hospitals of Central California”.
CHCC has a sort of confusing website setup. First, they have a website called communitymedical.org [1]. This site appears to be dedicated to the 4 Fresno and Clovis medical centers (listed below). However, they have a second website called cmcenters.org, which appears to be a much longer list of medical centers and administrative buildings that are primarily near Stockton.

Clovis Community Medical Center

2755 Herndon Avenue
Clovis, CA 93611
(559) 324-4000

Community Regional Medical Center

2823 Fresno Street
Fresno, CA 93721
(559) 459-6000

Fresno Heart & Surgical Hospital

15 E. Audubon Drive
Fresno, CA 93720
(559) 433-8000

Community Behavioral Health Center

7171 N. Cedar Avenue
Fresno, CA 93720
(559) 449-8000


The Locations Page on their site


A viewable version of Form 990 for CHCC [1] can be seen here.

title: 2. Operations
text:
The About Page on the CHCC [1] website says:

At Community Medical Centers (CMC), we’re passionate about improving health and well-being in the communities we call home. That’s why we work to ensure even our most vulnerable neighbors have affordable access to quality healthcare, regardless of age, income, or background. We offer integrated medical, dental, behavioral health, and supportive services, with a model of care that puts the patient at the center of a team-based approach. As one of the region’s largest healthcare providers, our growing network of neighborhood health centers serves over 100,000 patients in San Joaquin and Solano counties.

title: 2. Operations
text:
National Taxonomy of Exempt Entities
Community Hospitals of Central California’s NTEE Code: E300
Noting that the Urban Institute’s National Center for Charitable Statistics Website [2] has a list of NTEE codes. E300 is not among them. However, E30 appears in the list with the following description:
Ambulatory & Primary Health Care

Health centers, clinics, and other facilities that provide walk-in, walk-out diagnostic and treatment services for people whose care does not require confinement or a hospital stay. Use this code for types of outpatient facilities or services not specified below.

text: Products/Services

title: 2. Operations
text:
The About Page on the CHCC [1] website says:

At Community Medical Centers (CMC), we’re passionate about improving health and well-being in the communities we call home. That’s why we work to ensure even our most vulnerable neighbors have affordable access to quality healthcare, regardless of age, income, or background. We offer integrated medical, dental, behavioral health, and supportive services, with a model of care that puts the patient at the center of a team-based approach. As one of the region’s largest healthcare providers, our growing network of neighborhood health centers serves over 100,000 patients in San Joaquin and Solano counties.

title: 2. Operations
text:
Services
The Services Page on the CHCC [1] website lists the following services:

Adult Medicine
Behavioral Health
Dental Care
Care Link Community Outreach
Pediatrics and Adolescent Health
Pharmacy
Recovery
Women’s Health
Health Coverage Counseling
Health Education
Women, Infants and Children Program (WIC)

title: 1. Introduction
text:
Strategy

CHCC [1] is a non-profit primarily based in the Stockton area, with only 4 medical centers near Fresno. It could be a point of agitation to the community of Fresno that an out-of-town organization is the one that owns their hospitals.
